storyInfo: Eblana welcomes an unexpected guest in the city. In the ruins outside, Loughshinny witnesses a traditional Taran funeral's fire-returning ceremony.

attributes.content: I have already dismissed all the servants in the citadel. These footsteps, then...
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ...Your Highness.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Ah, it's you. Did you need something?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You aren't going to ask how I returned?
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: No, I won't. You came back, and that's all that matters, my loyal servant.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Besides, I have a fairly good idea of what sort of guest you can bring me.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Has the curfew started?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Just now.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Then you could say that my orders have been followed.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.text: ...failure...

attributes.content: Failure?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Na Saoirsí is here. I am here. What failure?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.text: ...escape...

attributes.content: The deadline is Samhain. Surely the black mist remembers this, even if it's hardly known for being a good listener.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.text: ...unsurprising...
...disappointing...
...unacceptable...

attributes.content: Am I meant to understand something from these few words?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Or perhaps... you, too, prefer the directness of Arts and destruction to the imprecision of language?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: No sooner do the words leave Eblana's lips than gleaming branches thrust forth from the dark mist, reaching for her throat.
At the same time, her spear penetrates the thick mist. Purple fire is faintly visible from within; she could burn it away to nothingness with a thought.
But the branches never find Eblana's throat, and her purple flames never ignite.
Samhain.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: By the time the sun rises on the day after Samhain, the outcome will be plain for all to see.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: So... why don't we dispense with these meaningless bluffs?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Eblana's spear still impales the mist, but the branches before her throat disappear a moment later, as do the flames at the tip of her spear.
The dark mist dissipates.
Your Highness...
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: You're still here.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Did you need something else? Is this about Dublinn?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: There are only the two of us here. I will permit you to speak that word again, my most loyal servant.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Thank you, but there is no need.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Spectres are but spectres, even if they helped found a nation. There is no place for ghosts in the history books.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: But I worry about my colleagues who stayed behind that day, as I did... Where are they? Could they mean you harm?
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: No need to worry. Even if there were, that is no reason for you to risk staying here.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ...I saw a scene of chaos on my way back.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: It was bedlam. People were fighting over the tiniest things... sometimes nothing at all. While others seemed to be stuck where they stood, like statues.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Just like the spectres who fought the Victorians with us.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Will they fade into darkness too?
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: This is Na Saoirsí, the Red Dragon's Lair, the capital of Tara. Anything that happens here will have repercussions across the nation.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: No, it won't.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You don't sound convinced.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Your Highness... I...
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: At the end of the day, I have just one question.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: One question I pray you will answer.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Very well. I will forgive your imprudence.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: (Takes a deep breath)
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Your Highness Eblana, that future...
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: That future you promised Dublinn, you promised Tara, that future where all Tarans could freely write their own dreams...
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Was it all a lie?
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: The Brigadier cannot stop himself from trembling. The fear that had lurked in his heart for days overcomes him.
It is not because he fears his own end. He is not afraid of being swallowed by the dark mist like his colleagues, or of invoking the red dragon's wrath.
He fears that he will hear an answer he dare not consider.
It was true, every word of it.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Your Highness...
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: I have answered your question, Brigadier.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The red dragon's voice seems ethereal, feeble even, but it leaves no room for questioning.
It is the voice that has led the man to victory countless times, and so he slowly straightens his back.
Then I trust you.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Perhaps... Or perhaps you simply have no other choice.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Often have you chosen a path that seemed baffling, impossible even. But it always ends up leading us closer to our dream. Of that I have no doubt.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Such deep trust is indeed worthy of my gratitude.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: However, I do not require you to maintain order within Na Saoirsí.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: If you managed to return from the Dark Woods, then you should return there now.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Until Samhain has passed?
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Until Samhain has passed.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Or...
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: 'I stepped into the dark woods one morn, calling to the mists of hoar'...
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Your Highness?
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Do you hear the song coming from beyond the woods?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Hardly a day has passed since you left... Fine work, Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Is that what's been happening in the city?!
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Reed, your sister... what is she planning?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I don't know.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Someone once told me that her plans would only ever be beneficial to Tara. Now, though, I can trust neither her nor the one who made that promise.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Are you still not going to help her, wakewoman?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: She came for a funeral, and we will only accept her for that.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: I have learned of the deeds of the departed.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Bring the knots and wreaths and come outside. The funeral is about to begin.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: The people set aside their differences and stand up in silence.

attributes.text: I stepped into the dark woods one morn, calling to the mists of hoar♪
I trod upon the road, heading out to war♪
No pipes a-singing, nor battle drums a-roar♪
Only the bells behind me, through dew and fog their rings do soar♪

attributes.content: The wakemen sing softly, each attending to their own duty.
Some adorn the coffin with knots and wreaths.
Some lay firewood and kindling around it.
Some distribute candles to the attending refugees as they continue to sing.
Tiny lights begin to sway throughout the camp.
Loughshinny has a candle too, which she carefully lifts in front of her chest.
Excuse me...
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: I didn't know the departed, and don't really have much to say... But where I grew up, people talked freely at funerals.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Certainly. This is how Tarans honor the departed.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Life should be celebrated, even after its end. The joy of the living is consolation to the dead. You are free to talk amongst each other.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: I also made some snacks...
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Please feel free to share them. We will also provide refreshments later.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: However, we must request that you exercise restraint, considering that Mr. Culann died before his time, and under unfortunate circumstances.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: We must also ask you to follow our instructions during the fire-returning ceremony.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Understood.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Is this how your folks hold funerals, Moran?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: We didn't have all these rites and ceremonies. All we did was keep watch through the night. No clue what this 'fire-returning' thing is either.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Guess we just follow their instructions.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Have you ever been part of a ceremony like this, Reed?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I see...
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: You mean...
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Loughshinny has found the wakemen. The hero's funeral has begun.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: 'I stepped into the dark woods one morn, calling to the mists of hoar; I trod upon the road, heading out to war'... Do you know this song?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You already know the answer.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: I lead the young into battle with it more than a few times.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: Who is it? Who's singing?
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Why is it that I still hear that song here at the site of the old capital, even after escaping the Dark Woods?
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Or am I still stuck in the woods?!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: No... no, the sound is coming from the furnace at the center of the ruins.
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Such a beautiful tune...
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: No pipes a-singing, nor battle drums a-roar...
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Only the bells behind me... through dew and fog their rings do soar...
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: I should go back...
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Now I see... what I truly want...
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Besides... do I really deserve... to escape Na Saoirsí?
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Here, Emma, today's bread.
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: Thanks for sharing your food in times like these.
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: You shared with me before. Just returning the favor.
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: But... why do you keep staring at the bread in my hand like that?
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: (Mutters) Control yourself... control yourself...
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: (Mutters) She's Emma... the one who shared bread with you... you must help her... you must—
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: (Deep breath) I'm fine, Emma.
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: I-I just meant to say, you've been bedridden for so long. There'll be tough times ahead.
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: 'No pipes a-singing, nor battle drums a-roar'...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Why are you singing that?
attributes.name: Anxious Resident

attributes.content: Someone's singing... in the distance...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Friends of the departed, please present your eulogy before the fire-returning ceremony begins.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Reed?
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: I... I have a eulogy here, written by Nemos. May I read it?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Of course. Go ahead.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: 'Dear Culann...'
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: A letter?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: 'Culann, perhaps it won't be long before I join you...'
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.text: Culann, perhaps it won't be long before I join you—before I become a slave of the purple flame, before I turn to ash.
Perhaps there won't be anyone to free me from an afterlife of eternal torment.
But I've never forgotten what you said to me.
You said you wanted to be a hero. You asked me to let you become one.
You said Na Saoirsí needed a hero for the postwar days, one who belonged only to us. Neither Dublinn nor soldier.
You said that nearly everyone in the city had lost something important in the war, be it a partner, a child, or a future.
Without a hero, an exemplar to understand them and fight for their rights, one who would also set them right should they go astray...
Without that, they wouldn't have anything to hold onto when the war ends, when they have no one left to hate.
I agreed and assented to your request.
You took Theo in, and helped the people who'd lost their livelihoods.
You thought everything was on the right path, and so you proposed the statue. You became fully immersed and took on a great burden.
By the time you realized... it was too late.
Now, it is my turn to carry this burden, one too heavy for any single person to bear.

attributes.content: '...Now, it is my turn to carry this burden, one too heavy for any single person to bear.'
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: 'Farewell, Culann. Slán leat. Or should I say, Slán go fóill.'
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: 'May we meet again...'
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: 'in the warm flames.'
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: As she finishes, a flame is thrown into the kindling surrounding the coffin, igniting the firewood.
The crowd gathers around the bonfire, following the instructions of the wakemen.
Witness that the departed has found peace in flames. He shall no longer wander the mortal realm.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Place your candle as close to the fire as possible, or throw it in directly. Return the fire to the departed.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: If you have anything to say to the departed, say it aloud to the flame. Be it praise or reproach, they are the memories that will console the departed at journey's end.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Once you have returned the fire, please remain to keep watch over his soul, until the fire has gone out.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Let us begin.
attributes.name: Solemn Wakewoman

attributes.content: Slán leat. May you find rest, stranger—
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: deceiver and hero.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Moran bends down and places her candle by the fire. The licking flames swallow it in an instant, almost burning her hand.
Do you want to come closer to the fire, Reed?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: If there's anyone here who doesn't deserve to pay respects to Culann, it would be me.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: You couldn't have saved him.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Moran?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: There was no place for him in the Red Dragon's Lair from the moment he made the choice to truly become a hero.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: You should return the fire to him.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Ashes to ashes, dust to dust. Let the dead rest with our memories, as life goes on.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Return the fire...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Let the dead rest with our memories... as life goes on?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: While Loughshinny is lost in thought, the others continue to return their fire and then sit down some distance from the bonfire, until she is the only one left with a candle in her hand.
She walks forward in silence, and tosses the candle into the blazing bonfire.
The dead are gone.
All their ambition, obsession, realization and desperation turn to fading smoke and silent ash in the flames.
